I had a pet pig when I was a kid, not a tea cup pig, like the same kind you eat. He got huge! That pig got to be about 450 pounds and was smaller than he could of gotten because he was gelded shortly after birth. He was super sweet though and you could walk him on a leash and ride him (though it wasn't very comfortable). He lived in an insulated shed in the backyard with our dogs. He went for walks everyday with the "pack" and I'm pretty sure he though he was actually a dog.

tea cup pigs dont exist. mini is a size classification (anything under 300lbs) not a breed! its parents werent small they were just young. pigs reach sexual maturity at like 12 weeks. greeders breed them young to show small parents and give people false expectations. pigs dont reach full size until around 5 years. educate yourself before getting a pig and or buying into all the false info out there

what she means is "Clicker training" wich is a training based on a sort of Pavlovian response where after an animal (dog or pig for instance) have correctly executed a command (like "sit" or "down" or any other command) the handler pushes a button on a small device wich will then make a clicking sound, when in the beginning stages of "clicker training" usually a treat is presented right after sounding the clicker, and that is where the paclovian response comes in, because if you do that often enough, the click followed by the presented treat, the animal in traing will start to link the 2 together, until after a while they seem to become synonimous and only the sound of the clicker is needed to act as the full reward, in short that means that "clicker training" is a training with the goal of rewarding with a specific clicking noise through a pavlovian like response
